{'headline': 'Report Criticizes U.N.\xe2\x80\x99s Handling of Child Sex Abuse Allegations', 'abstract': "United Nations failed to process allegations of child sexual abuse by its peacekeepers in Central African Republic, according to independent investigation; scandal is latest in series which cast doubt on UN's primary mission of protecting innocent civilians; report suggests UN bureaucratic dysfunction contributed to inaction.", 'locations': [u'Central African Republic', u'France'], 'word_count': 1009, 'snippet': 'A panel said the United Nations failed to meet its own standards in investigating allegations of the abuse of boys by French soldiers in the Central African Republic.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'Sex Crimes', u'Defense and Military Forces', u'Human Rights and Human Rights Violations', u'Refugees and Displaced Persons'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/18/world/africa/report-criticizes-uns-handling-of-child-sex-abuse-allegations.html', 'date': u'2015-12-18', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'5673044f38f0d85bed90f335'}

{'headline': 'Jozef Wesolowski, Ex-Archbishop Accused of Sexual Abuse, Dies at 67', 'abstract': 'Vatican reports defrocked archbishop Jozef Wesolowski, on trial for child sexual abuse and facing up to eight years in prison, was found dead in his Vatican City residence while under house arrest; former high-level cleric is accused of sexually abusing children while he was Vatican ambassador in Dominican Republic from 2008 to 2013.', 'locations': [u'Dominican Republic', u'Rome (Italy)'], 'word_count': 551, 'snippet': 'He would have been the first high-level prelate to stand before a Vatican tribunal on such charges, but illness prevented the trial from proceeding.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sex Crimes', u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'Deaths (Obituaries)', u'Priests'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/29/world/europe/jozef-wesolowski-polish-ex-archbishop-accused-of-child-sexual-abuse-is-found-dead.html', 'date': u'2015-08-29', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'55e04eab38f0d81634aff699'}

{'headline': 'The St. Paul\xe2\x80\x99s Rape Case Shows Why Sexual-Assault Laws Must Change', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 1194, 'snippet': 'In many states, laws requiring evidence that force was used in a rape would have made it difficult for the accuser to bring charges at all.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sex Crimes'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/26/magazine/the-st-pauls-rape-case-shows-why-sexual-assault-laws-must-change.html', 'date': u'2015-08-26', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'55de12c438f0d87d7f5f1aa8'}

{'headline': 'U.N. Details Sexual Abuse Claims Against Troops', 'abstract': 'United Nations officials release new information regarding sex abuse claims against UN peacekeepers in Central African Republic; say nine of 13 cases reported involved children as young as 11 years of age and no convictions have occurred to date.', 'locations': [u'Central African Republic'], 'word_count': 435, 'snippet': 'The United Nations said that nine of the 13 cases reported against its peacekeepers in the Central African Republic in the past year involved children as young as 11 and that no one had yet been convicted.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sex Crimes', u'Child Abuse and Neglect'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/21/world/africa/un-details-sexual-abuse-claims-against-troops.html', 'date': u'2015-08-21', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'55d67ad338f0d81d6b2efeff'}

{'headline': 'Any Sexual Abuse by Guards May Violate Inmates\xe2\x80\x99 Rights, Court Says', 'abstract': 'Unanimous decision by three-judge panel on federal appeals court rules that prisoners who are subjected to any kind of malicious sexual conduct by prison guards may have had their constitutional rights violated; decision allows furthering of case involving paroled prisoners James Crawford and Thaddeus Corley, who complained about sexually demeaning actions of Officer Simon Prindle while they were imprisoned at Eastern Correctional Facility.', 'locations': [u'New York State'], 'word_count': 783, 'snippet': 'Any malicious sexual contact by prison guards against prisoners may be a constitutional violation, a federal appeals court ruled on Tuesday, noting how society\xe2\x80\x99s standards of decency have evolved.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Prisons and Prisoners', u'Prison Guards and Corrections Officers', u'Sex Crimes'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/12/nyregion/any-sexual-abuse-by-guards-may-violate-inmates-rights-court-says.html', 'date': u'2015-08-12', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'55ca985538f0d81d0840289b'}

{'headline': 'Widespread Child Sexual Abuse Case Rocks Pakistan', 'abstract': "Officials in Pakistan are opening inquiry into charges that gang of 15 men in Punjab Province has sexually abused at least 280 children under age 14 and sold videos of the abuse to pornographic websites or used recordings to extort money from victims' families.", 'locations': [u'Pakistan'], 'word_count': 777, 'snippet': 'Allegations that a gang of men abused at least 280 children, and sold videos of the abuse, have led to seven arrests.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sex Crimes', u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'Child Pornography', u'Gangs', u'Social Media', u'Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/10/world/asia/widespread-child-sex-abuse-case-rocks-pakistan.html', 'date': u'2015-08-10', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'55c7c91838f0d8757841e839'}

{'headline': 'Producer Acquitted of Top Sexual Assault Charge; Mistrial on Other Counts ', 'abstract': 'Derrick Harris, former producer for hip-hop group the Wu Tang Clan, is acquitted of criminal sexual act charge, top sexual assault charge he faced in connection with 2011 incident; judge declares mistrial on several other counts.', 'locations': [u'Manhattan (NYC)'], 'word_count': 822, 'snippet': 'The trial of Derrick Harris, a former producer for the Wu Tang Clan hip-hop group who was accused in a Harlem attack, ended with a deadlocked jury.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sex Crimes', u'Jury System', u'Rap and Hip-Hop'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/08/nyregion/producer-acquitted-of-top-sexual-assault-charge-mistrial-on-other-counts.html', 'date': u'2015-08-08', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'55c5637038f0d85949ad6879'}

{'headline': 'Review: ‘Threesome,’ at 59E59 Theaters, Examines Sexual Inequality', 'abstract': 'Charles Isherwood reviews Yussef El Guindi play Threesome, directed by Chris Coleman at 59E59 Theaters; Alia Attallah, Karan Oberoi and Quinn Franzen star.', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 905, 'snippet': 'In Yussef El Guindi’s play, two male photographers attempt a ménage à trois with a female writer, only to encounter unexpected revelations.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Theater'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2015/07/23/theater/review-threesome-at-59e59-theaters-examines-sexual-inequality.html', 'date': u'2015-07-23', 'type': u'Review', 'id': u'55b04ab238f0d8067da4c54c'}

{'headline': 'Asked About Cosby Scandal, Obama Weighs In on a Sexual Violence Discussion', 'abstract': 'Pres Obama bluntly states that actions of which Bill Cosby is accused, drugging women for sex, constitute rape and should in no way be tolerated by American people.', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 556, 'snippet': 'While not directly commenting on suits against Mr. Cosby, Obama said drugging someone and then having nonconsensual sex was nothing short of rape.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sex Crimes', u'Sedatives', u'Presidential Medal of Freedom'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2015/07/16/us/obama-wades-into-growing-sexual-scandal-surrounding-bill-cosby.html', 'date': u'2015-07-16', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'55a6bdcb38f0d8559844f580'}

{'headline': 'To Prevent Sexual Assault, Start Early', 'abstract': 'Editorial, citing growing visibility of sexual assault on college campuses, points to growing body of research suggesting that providing children with quality sex education, along with teaching communication and emotion management to younger students, is effective way to reduce sexual assault later in life; hold that schools, state governments and families alike need to understand importance of early education about sexual assault.', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 404, 'snippet': 'Comprehensive sexuality education has to start well before college, when it\xe2\x80\x99s already too late.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Editorials', u'Education (K-12)', u'Sexual Harassment', u'Colleges and Universities', u'Research', u'Sex Crimes'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2015/07/14/opinion/to-prevent-sexual-assault-start-early.html', 'date': u'2015-07-14', 'type': u'Editorial', 'id': u'55a4b87138f0d81cee805738'}

{'headline': 'France Arrests 2 Soldiers Accused of Sexual Abuse in Burkina Faso', 'locations': [u'France', u'Burkina Faso'], 'word_count': 305, 'snippet': 'The Frenchmen are suspected of having abused two girls, ages 3 and 5, in a hotel pool in Ouagadougou, the capital, the Paris prosecutor\xe2\x80\x99s office said.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sex Crimes', u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'Defense and Military Forces'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2015/07/03/world/europe/france-arrests-2-soldiers-accused-of-sexual-abuse-in-burkina-faso.html', 'date': u'2015-07-03', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'5595260f38f0d8085ef56953'}

{'headline': 'New York City Schools Official Charged With Sexual Abuse', 'abstract': 'New York City schools administrator John DiFiore is arraigned on charges of endangering and sexually touching a 14-year-old boy at his Manhattan home; DiFiore plans to fight charges.', 'locations': [u'New York City'], 'word_count': 323, 'snippet': 'The administrator, John DiFiore, has been charged with endangering and sexually touching a 14-year-old boy at his home in Manhattan.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'Sex Crimes'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2015/06/18/nyregion/new-york-city-schools-official-charged-with-sexual-abuse.html', 'date': u'2015-06-18', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'5582323a38f0d837d1b0b207'}

{'headline': 'New York\xe2\x80\x99s Lawmakers Agree on Campus Sexual Assault Laws', 'abstract': "New York State lawmakers propose legislation intended to address issue of sexual assault on college campuses; bill would create statewide definition of 'affirmative consent,' establish new unit in State Police and require campuses to inform students about their rights and how to report assaults.", 'locations': [u'New York State'], 'word_count': 874, 'snippet': 'The deal was announced on what was thought to be the penultimate day of this year\xe2\x80\x99s legislative session, but a number of other issues remained unresolved.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Colleges and Universities', u'Sex Crimes', u'Law and Legislation', u'State Legislatures', u'Rent Control and Stabilization'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2015/06/17/nyregion/new-yorks-lawmakers-agree-on-campus-sexual-assault-laws.html', 'date': u'2015-06-17', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'5580c35738f0d81a60726ecf'}

{'headline': 'Vatican Sets Trial for Ex-Ambassador Accused of Sexual Abuse', 'abstract': 'Vatican sets date for trial of Jozef Wesolowski, former envoy and archbishop to Dominican Republic, on child sexual abuse and child pornography charges; trial will be first of its kind under new criminal procedure rules enacted by Pope Francis in response to global outcry over handling of sexual abuse cases.', 'locations': [u'Dominican Republic', u'Caribbean Area'], 'word_count': 571, 'snippet': 'The Vatican said that in July it would open a trial of its former envoy, Jozef Wesolowski, to the Dominican Republic on charges of sexually abusing boys and of possessing child pornography.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sex Crimes', u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'Child Pornography'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2015/06/16/world/europe/vatican-sets-trial-for-ex-ambassador-accused-of-sexual-abuse.html', 'date': u'2015-06-16', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'557ec91538f0d86829e41300'}

{'headline': 'Sexual Assault Charges Dropped at Annapolis', 'abstract': 'Charges in sexual assault case are dropped against Naval Academy midshipman Eric Graham after his statements about encounter were determined to be inadmissible as he had not been read his rights before questioning; decision means only Joshua Tate, one of three former football players accused of sexually assaulting a female midshipman in 2012, will face court-martial; charges were never brought against the third.', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 790, 'snippet': 'The decision to drop the charges came as the Pentagon released its annual report on sexual assault and sexual harassment at the three service academies.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'United States Defense and Military Forces', u'Sexual Harassment', u'Sex Crimes'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2014/01/11/us/politics/sex-assault-charges-dropped-at-annapolis.html', 'date': u'2014-01-11', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'52d0924738f0d813df3a79c5'}

Benedict Groeschel, who has spent years counseling wayward priests for the Archdiocese of New York, said in an interview that the young victim is often the \xe2\x80\x9cseducer.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Priests', u'Sex Crimes', u'Child Abuse and Neglect'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/08/31/nyregion/in-interview-the-rev-benedict-groeschel-says-abuse-victims-can-be-seducers.html', 'date': u'2012-08-31', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'53fa66f038f0d8431914d781'}

{'headline': '2 Women Received $32,000 From Assemblyman, Beyond Money From State', 'abstract': 'Legal settlement has surfaced between New York Assemblyman Vito J Lopez and two women who brought sexual harassment claims against him; the women apparently received $32,000 from Lopez, in addition to $103,080 in state money, as well as an unspecified amount of pay and benefits; as part of the agreement, Lopez and members of his staff had to attend a class on avoiding sexual harassment.', 'locations': [u'New York State'], 'word_count': 1001, 'snippet': 'In addition to a $103,080 payment in state money, a copy of a settlement agreement revealed that Assemblyman Vito J. {'headline': 'School Abuse Case May Proceed, Judge Says', 'abstract': "Judge Frederic Block of Federal District Court in Brooklyn rules that Poly Prep, top-tier Brooklyn private school, cannot automatically use New York State's statue of limitations to prevent a case involving sexual abuse allegations against former football coach Philip Foglietta from proceeding; Foglietta, who started working at the school in 1966, died in 1998.", 'locations': [u'Brooklyn (NYC)', u'New York City'], 'word_count': 910, 'snippet': 'The ruling, that the statute of limitations does not automatically apply, will pave the way for a hearing to establish whether the school, Poly Prep, covered up sexual abuse.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Private and Sectarian Schools', u'Sex Crimes', u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'Statutes of Limitations', u'Suits and Litigation', u'Decisions and Verdicts', u'Education (K-12)'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/08/29/nyregion/poly-prep-sexual-abuse-case-may-proceed-judge-rules.html', 'date': u'2012-08-29', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'515d9bbecf28d0219d000460'}

{'headline': 'Horace Mann Details Steps to Address Sexual Abuse Cases', 'abstract': 'Horace Mann School announces a series of steps to address reports of past sexual abuse at the elite private institution in the Bronx; school officials will work with the New York Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children to review procedures, train faculty and staff members and develop prevention programs for students; officials also pledge that all employees will undergo extensive background checks.', 'locations': [u'Bronx (NYC)', u'New York City'], 'word_count': 431, 'snippet': 'The private school\xe2\x80\x99s board announced a plan for training and prevention programs in reaction to accusations of past sexual abuse of students by faculty members.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Education (K-12)', u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'Sex Crimes'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/08/07/nyregion/horace-mann-school-details-steps-to-handle-sexual-abuse-reports.html', 'date': u'2012-08-07', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'515d9dc7cf28d0219d00087a'}

{'headline': 'For Women in Street Stops, Deeper Humiliation', 'abstract': 'Law enforcement data shows that in 2001, New York City officers frisked nearly 16,000 women; laws governing street stops are blind to gender, but critics say stops of women by male officers often involve additional embarrassment and sexual intimidation.', 'locations': [u'New York City'], 'word_count': 1447, 'snippet': 'In 2011, New York City officers frisked nearly 16,000 women; stops of women by male officers, some say, often involve additional embarrassment and sexual intimidation.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Search and Seizure', u'Sexual Harassment', u'Women and Girls', u'Police Brutality and Misconduct'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/08/07/nyregion/for-women-in-street-stops-deeper-humiliation.html', 'date': u'2012-08-07', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'53f994d738f0d84410bcb130'}

{'headline': 'Alumni Criticism Grows Over Horace Mann’s Response to Reports of Sexual Abuse', 'abstract': "Alumni of Horace Mann School in the Bronx are criticizing school's response to recent reports of sexual abuse of students by teachers, calling for more proactive support and healing for those who were abused; revelations come at a particularly bad time for the school, as it seeks donations to raise $90 million for new facilities while grappling with the scandal.", 'locations': [u'Bronx (NYC)', u'New York City'], 'word_count': 1451, 'snippet': 'Former students are pushing for more proactive support and healing for those who were abused as school officials grapple with how to address the scandal.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sex Crimes', u'Private and Sectarian Schools', u'Education (K-12)', u'Child Abuse and Neglect'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/07/05/nyregion/alumni-criticism-grows-over-horace-manns-response-to-reports-of-sexual-abuse.html', 'date': u'2012-07-05', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'515da060cf28d0219d000e83'}

{'headline': 'More Women Look Over the Counter for a Libido Fix', 'abstract': 'More women are turning to over-the-counter products to increase sexual arousal and pleasure, and companies are responding by creating more products for them; some express concern that commercial efforts to address female sexual dysfunction, which remains difficult to define, may pressure women to see a problem where one does not exist.', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 1186, 'snippet': 'Female sexual dysfunction remains a controversial topic, even as it becomes an official diagnosis and companies have begun creating more products to address it.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Women and Girls', u'Sex', u'Drugs (Pharmaceuticals)'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/07/03/health/more-women-seek-over-the-counter-sexual-remedies.html', 'date': u'2012-07-03', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'51c216fd7e0d9c0839d2a2fd'}

{'headline': 'Researchers See Decline in Child Sexual Abuse Rate', 'abstract': 'Overall cases of child sexual abuse have been decreasing steadily in the United States, falling more than 60 percent from 1992 to 2010; experts cite the recent series of prominent sexual abuse cases as evidence that victims have become more willing to come forward and accuse their abusers.', 'locations': [u'United States'], 'word_count': 1107, 'snippet': 'Child sexual abuse in the United States, while still significant, has been decreasing steadily by several critical measures.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sex Crimes', u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'Crime Rates', u'Education (K-12)'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/06/29/us/rate-of-child-sexual-abuse-on-the-decline.html', 'date': u'2012-06-29', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'53f84c3138f0d835538dc94f'}

{'headline': '2 Philadelphia Priests Punished in Sexual Abuse Cases', 'abstract': 'Two more Roman Catholic priests from the Archdiocese of Philadelphia, George J Mazotta and Hugh P Campbell, are found to be unsuitable for ministry after sexually abusing children; both men had held a series of positions in parishes and hospitals since the 1960s.', 'locations': [u'Philadelphia (Pa)'], 'word_count': 398, 'snippet': 'The two were monsignors found unsuitable for ministry after sexually abusing children in parishes and hospitals since the 1960s.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sex Crimes', u'Priests', u'Child Abuse and Neglect'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/05/22/us/two-more-priests-found-unsuitable-in-philadelphia.html', 'date': u'2012-05-22', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'53f6fa7338f0d821a37b291f'}

{'headline': 'For Ultra-Orthodox, Clash Over Allegations', 'abstract': "Group of about 100 people gather to support a young woman who alleges that Nechemya Weberman sexually assaulted her; case has become a source of anger and division in Brooklyn's ultra-Orthodox Jewish community.", 'locations': [u'Williamsburg (NYC)'], 'word_count': 351, 'snippet': 'About 100 people supporting the girl who said she was sexually assaulted by Nechemya Weberman rallied Wednesday night outside a fund-raiser for Mr. Weberman\xe2\x80\x99s legal defense.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Demonstrations, Protests, and Riots', u'Jews and Judaism', u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'Sex Crimes'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/05/17/nyregion/supporters-clash-at-event-for-ultra-orthodox-man-accused-of-sexual-assault.html', 'date': u'2012-05-17', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'53f6d4b638f0d821a37b272d'}

{'headline': 'Ultra-Orthodox Shun Their Own for Reporting Child Sexual Abuse', 'locations': [u'New York City'], 'word_count': 2727, 'snippet': 'In confronting Jewish laws that forbid airing allegations against fellow Jews or turning them in to the police, families of ultra-Orthodox victims who have been molested face intimidation by their communities.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Jews and Judaism', u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'Sex Crimes', u'Hasidism'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/05/10/nyregion/ultra-orthodox-jews-shun-their-own-for-reporting-child-sexual-abuse.html', 'date': u'2012-05-10', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'53ea452238f0d8422fc728a9'}

{'headline': 'Ex-Officer Sentenced to 75 Years in Prison for Sexual Assault', 'abstract': 'Justice Richard D Carruthers of State Supreme Court in Manhattan sentences former police officer Michael Pena to 75 years to life in prison for sexually assaulting a school teacher in Upper Manhattan; Pena is not convicted of rape.', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 735, 'snippet': 'Michael Pena, who was convicted of attacking a schoolteacher at gunpoint while off duty, was sentenced to three consecutive terms of 25 years to life in prison.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sex Crimes', u'Sentences (Criminal)'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/05/08/nyregion/ex-officer-sentenced-to-75-years-in-prison-for-sexual-assault.html', 'date': u'2012-05-08', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'53f67e6538f0d821a37b2294'}

{'headline': 'Strauss-Kahn Faces Allegations of Sexually Assaulting Woman at a Hotel in Washington', 'abstract': "French prosecutors seek to widen investigation of Dominique Strauss-Kahn, former International Monetary Fund chief, to look into accusations that he sexually assaulted a woman at a Washington hotel in 2010; Strauss-Kahn's lawyers denounce accusations, noting they come two days before hotly contested runoff vote for the French presidency.", 'locations': [u'France', u'Washington (DC)'], 'word_count': 510, 'snippet': 'Investigators are examining allegations that Dominique Strauss-Kahn was involved in an assault at a Washington hotel in 2010, a spokesman at the prosecutor\xe2\x80\x99s office in Lille said on Friday.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sex Crimes', u'Prostitution', u'Suits and Litigation', u'Assaults', u'Elections'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/05/05/world/europe/new-sex-allegations-against-strauss-kahn.html', 'date': u'2012-05-05', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'51c1fa6e7e0d9c0839d29f6d'}

{'headline': 'Judge in Civil Case Rejects Immunity for Strauss-Kahn', 'abstract': "Justice Douglas E McKeon of State Supreme Court in the Bronx rejects Dominique Strauss-Kahn's claim of diplomatic immunity in his effort to dismiss civil suit filed by Nafissatou Diallo, hotel housekeeper who claims he sexually assaulted her; McKeon notes that Strauss-Kahn resigned as head of International Monetary Fund before the suit was even filed.", 'locations': [u'New York City'], 'word_count': 470, 'snippet': 'A judge said Dominique Strauss-Kahn\xe2\x80\x99s effort to dismiss a suit by a hotel housekeeper was a \xe2\x80\x9cHail Mary pass.\xe2\x80\x9d', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Suits and Litigation', u'Diplomatic Immunity', u'Sex Crimes'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/05/02/nyregion/strauss-kahns-claim-of-diplomatic-immunity-is-rejected.html', 'date': u'2012-05-02', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'51c1f9087e0d9c0839d29f40'}

{'headline': 'Appeals Panel Overturns Conviction of Lebovits in Sexual Abuse Case', 'abstract': "New York appeals court panel overturns 2010 conviction of cantor Baruch Lebovits for the repeated sexual assault of a teenager; four-judge panel rules that while there was evidence to prove Lebovits's guilt, prosecution's delays in turning over evidence deprived him of a fair trial.", 'locations': [u'Brooklyn (NYC)'], 'word_count': 431, 'snippet': 'The panel ruled that while there was evidence to prove that Baruch Lebovits had molested a teenager, he had been deprived of a fair trial because a detective\xe2\x80\x99s notes had not been promptly turned over.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Decisions and Verdicts', u'Sex Crimes'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/04/26/nyregion/conviction-of-baruch-lebovits-in-sex-abuse-case-is-overturned.html', 'date': u'2012-04-26', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'53bdb25a38f0d86093120a46'}

{'headline': 'Patterns: Brain Scans Forecast Eating and Sexual Behavior', 'abstract': 'Kathryn E Demos study in the Journal of Neuroscience finds that women whose brains demonstrate greater activity in response to pictures of food are more likely to gain weight than those whose brains did not respond; also finds that greater brain activity in response to sexual images is linked to higher levels of self-reported sexual desire.', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 241, 'snippet': 'Researchers have succeeded in predicting eating behavior and levels of sexual desire in people by scanning their brains.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Women and Girls', u'Brain', u'Sex', u'Research', u'Food', u'Weight'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/04/24/health/research/brain-scans-forecast-eating-and-sexual-behavior-in-women.html', 'date': u'2012-04-24', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'53f5fe8838f0d87ef470edcc'}

{'headline': 'Yoga and Sex Scandals: No Surprise Here', 'abstract': "Many followers of John Friend, founder of fast-growing Yoga technique Anusara, are discouraged after learning that he has been accused of sexual impropriety with a number of female students; Friend's fall from grace is emblematic of the sexually-charged nature of Yoga, which began as a Tantric practice, and has often been associated with sexual scandal; some researchers are beginning to understand the physiological underpinnings of how Yoga leads to arousal.", 'locations': [], 'word_count': 1325, 'snippet': 'Since the baby boomers discovered yoga, the arousal, sweating, heavy breathing and states of undress that characterize yoga classes have led to predictable results.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Yoga', u'Sex'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/02/28/health/nutrition/yoga-fans-sexual-flames-and-predictably-plenty-of-scandal.html', 'date': u'2012-02-28', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'53f4083238f0d857ea2d0a90'}

{'headline': 'Chancellor Vows to Fire Those Guilty of Sexually Abusing Students', 'abstract': 'New York City Schools Chancellor Dennis M Walcott promises to review all substantiated cases of teaching staff accused of sexual misconduct charges involving students dating back to 2000, and pledges dismissals in accordance with findings; Education Department hopes to quell anxiety after three separate incidents in which New York City school teachers or staff have been arrested and accused of sexual crimes involving students.', 'locations': [u'New York City'], 'word_count': 918, 'snippet': 'Dennis M. {'headline': 'Aide Accused of Taping Sexual Acts With Students', 'abstract': "Taleek Brooks, a teacher's aide in a Brooklyn public school who was released on bail in January in connection with charges of possessing child pornography, is arrested again; federal agents reviewing videos from the original arrest discovered some showing Brooks engaging in sexual acts with students, apparently inside the school.", 'locations': [u'Crown Heights (NYC)', u'New York City'], 'word_count': 683, 'snippet': 'The aide, Taleek Brooks, 40, may have made the videos of sexual acts with students inside Public School 243, in Crown Heights, Brooklyn, law enforcement officials said.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Child Pornography', u'Sex Crimes', u'Education (K-12)', u'Child Abuse and Neglect'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/02/08/nyregion/school-aide-accused-of-abusing-students-in-videos.html', 'date': u'2012-02-08', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'515dada9cf28d0219d002c1f'}

{'headline': 'Catholic Leaders Convene to Discuss Abuse Prevention', 'abstract': 'Leaders of the Roman Catholic Church begin a four-day symposium about the prevention of sexual abuse of minors by the clergy, an unprecedented assembly described by the Vatican as a response to a painful issue that has wracked the church and estranged many of its faithful; religious superiors as well as abuse victims are invited.', 'locations': [u'Rome (Italy)'], 'word_count': 679, 'snippet': 'Religious superiors as well as abuse victims were invited to a symposium in Rome. Some wondered what action would come from the meeting.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'Priests', u'Sex Crimes'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/02/07/world/europe/roman-catholic-church-convenes-assembly-on-abuse-prevention.html', 'date': u'2012-02-07', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'53f34d3738f0d847437e079a'}

{'headline': 'Yale Fulfills Vow on Sex-Misconduct Report', 'abstract': 'Yale University releases its first report describing complaints of sexual misconduct and how they were handled, making good on a promise of transparency on the issue; report covers the period from July 1 to the end of 2011, listing 52 allegations of misconduct by students and employees, ranging from harassing remarks to sexual assault, but none of the allegations ended with the filing of police charges.', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 543, 'snippet': 'Yale University, in an effort to be more transparent about its handling of sexual misconduct, released a report detailing accusations including harassing remarks and rape.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sexual Harassment', u'Sex Crimes', u'Colleges and Universities'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/02/02/nyregion/in-yale-report-52-complaints-of-sexual-misconduct.html', 'date': u'2012-02-02', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'515dae17cf28d0219d002d46'}

{'headline': 'Hollywood Fixer Opens His Little Black Book', 'abstract': 'Scotty Bower\xe2\x80\x99s memoir Full Service: My Adventures in Hollywood and the Secret Sex Lives of the Stars, offers a lurid account of his experiences running a prostitution ring for gay, lesbian and bisexual members of the film industry during the 1940s, 50s and 60s.', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 1619, 'snippet': 'Scotty Bower\xe2\x80\x99s new memoir, \xe2\x80\x9cFull Service: My Adventures in Hollywood and the Secret Sex Lives of the Stars,\xe2\x80\x9d offers a lurid account of trawling an X-rated underworld.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Actors and Actresses', u'Movies', u'Homosexuality', u'Celebrities', u'Books and Literature'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/01/29/fashion/scotty-bowers-and-his-sexual-tell-all-of-old-hollywood.html', 'date': u'2012-01-29', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'515dae8fcf28d0219d002e38'}

{'headline': 'A Touch During Recess, and Reaction Is Swift', 'locations': [u'San Francisco Bay Area (Calif)'], 'word_count': 746, 'snippet': 'The incident of the 6-year-old boy suspended from elementary school for a case of \xe2\x80\x9csexual assault\xe2\x80\x9d is not isolated, experts say.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'School Discipline (Students)', u'Sex Crimes', u'Education (K-12)', u'Children and Childhood'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2012/01/27/education/boy-6-suspended-in-sexual-assault-case-at-elementary-school.html', 'date': u'2012-01-27', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'53f2ef5738f0d847437e01ce'}

{'headline': 'Patterns: HPV Vaccine Is Not Linked to Promiscuity', 'abstract': 'Study by Nicole C Liddon published in American Journal of Preventive Medicine finds girls ages 15 to 19 who are vaccinated against HPV are no more likely to be sexually active or to have more partners than unvaccinated girls.', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 235, 'snippet': 'A survey has found that girls ages 15 to 19 who are vaccinated against human papillomavirus, or HPV, are no more likely to be sexually active.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Human Papilloma Virus (HPV)', u'Vaccination and Immunization', u'Sexually Transmitted Diseases', u'Women and Girls', u'Sex'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/27/health/research/no-link-is-seen-between-hpv-vaccine-and-girls-sexual-risks.html', 'date': u'2011-12-27', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'51c1c7367e0d9c0839d29927'}

{'headline': 'Warriors Star Accused of Sexual Harassment', 'abstract': 'Erika Ross Smith, former Golden State Warriors employee, files a sexual harassment lawsuit against Golden States star guard Monta Ellis, saying he sent her unwanted texts that included a photo of his genitals; other NBA news noted.', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 246, 'snippet': 'A former Golden State Warriors employee filed a sexual harassment lawsuit against the star guard Monta Ellis, saying Ellis sent her unwanted texts that included a photo of his genitals.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sexual Harassment', u'Basketball', u'Suits and Litigation'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/22/sports/basketball/warriors-star-ellis-accused-of-sexual-harassment.html', 'date': u'2011-12-22', 'type': u'Brief', 'id': u'515db15bcf28d0219d0034cf'}

{'headline': 'Supportive Steps After a Sexual Assault', 'abstract': 'Jane E Brody Personal Health column offers advice on how to proceed if loved one becomes the victim of a sexual assault; notes survey released by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention that found sexual assaults are far more common than previously believed, with nearly one woman in five reporting that she had been the victim of rape or attempted rape.', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 1124, 'snippet': 'There are many centers, which should be the first stop for victims, that offer proper care and increase the likelihood that their attackers are punished.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sex Crimes', u'Women and Girls', u'Medicine and Health'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/20/health/supportive-steps-to-take-after-a-sexual-assault.html', 'date': u'2011-12-20', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'5404601e38f0d80e250f4c66'}

{'headline': 'Dutch Bishops Apologize for Sexual Abuse', 'abstract': "Roman Catholic bishops in the Netherlands offer 'sincere apologies' to victims of child sexual abuse; apology is issued hours after an independent Dutch commission announces its conclusion that church officials had failed to adequately deal with sexual abuse by clergy that affected as many as 20,000 Dutch children in Catholic institutions going as far back as 1945.", 'locations': [u'Netherlands'], 'word_count': 980, 'snippet': 'An official commission in the Netherlands had received some 1,800 reports of abuse at Catholic schools, seminaries and orphanages.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'Sex Crimes', u'Priests'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/17/world/europe/thousands-abused-in-church-institutions-dutch-report-says.html', 'date': u'2011-12-17', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'51f969a638f0d807d7762810'}

{'headline': 'Statue Deepens Dispute Over Wartime Sexual Slavery', 'abstract': 'Life-size bronze statue of a young Korean girl, representing the Korean women forced to be sex slaves for the Japanese military during World War II, is erected across from the Japanese Embassy in Seoul; sculpture quickly becomes the focal point of a simmering diplomatic dispute as Pres Lee Myung-bak prepares to visit Tokyo, with the Japanese government demanding the removal of the installation.', 'locations': [u'South Korea', u'Japan'], 'word_count': 524, 'snippet': 'A statue was installed near the Japan embassy in Seoul to protest sexual slavery during World War II.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity', u'Prostitution', u'Monuments and Memorials', u'World War II (1939-45)', u'Demonstrations, Protests, and Riots', u'Reparations and Restitution', u'Women and Girls'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/16/world/asia/statute-in-seoul-becomes-focal-point-of-dispute-between-south-korea-and-japan.html', 'date': u'2011-12-16', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'520c7c7c38f0d8740ac8ba30'}

{'headline': 'Former N.B.A. Employee Says Sexual Harassment Concerns Were Ignored', 'abstract': "Suit brought against NBA by former security official Warren Glover says he repeatedly warned his superiors that women in his office were being sexually harassed or discriminated against; contends his concerns were ignored, and that he was ultimately fired for his actions on the women's behalf.", 'locations': [], 'word_count': 1383, 'snippet': 'Warren Glover, who was fired as a security director in July, claims that he repeatedly warned his superiors in the N.B.A.\xe2\x80\x99s security department that women in the office were being sexually harassed.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Suits and Litigation', u'Sexual Harassment', u'Discrimination', u'Basketball'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/16/sports/basketball/former-nba-official-says-sex-harassment-concerns-were-ignored.html', 'date': u'2011-12-16', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'51c1c3bc7e0d9c0839d298bc'}

{'headline': 'A Renewed Push to Allow Later Reports of Sexual Abuse', 'abstract': 'New York State lawmakers plan to revisit lifting time limits on lawsuits by victims of child sexual abuse; opponents, including the Roman Catholic Church and other institutions, have helped block similar measures, fearing millions in payouts; State Assembly has passed such legislation three times, with the bills dying in the Senate.', 'locations': [u'New York State'], 'word_count': 363, 'snippet': 'Similar legislation has died in the New York Senate in the past, but bills have again been introduced on the heels of college sports scandals.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'State Legislatures', u'Sex Crimes', u'Law and Legislation', u'Statutes of Limitations'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/15/nyregion/child-sex-abuse-scandals-renew-push-in-new-york-for-law-lifting-time-limits.html', 'date': u'2011-12-15', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'54043d6338f0d80e250f4a82'}

{'headline': 'The Twice-Victimized of Sexual Assault', 'abstract': 'Jane E Brody Personal Health column asserts that today, despite improvements in early sex education and widespread publicity about sexual assaults, the overwhelming majority of both federal and misdemeanor cases never come to public or legal attention; notes that 15 of 16 rapists will never spend time in jail.', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 1116, 'snippet': 'Nearly every woman I know can recall one or more instances in which she was sexually assaulted, harassed, threatened, inappropriately touched or even raped.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Sexual Harassment', u'Sex Crimes', u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'Assaults', u'Women and Girls', u'Mental Health and Disorders', u'Medicine and Health'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/13/health/the-twice-victimized-of-sexual-assault.html', 'date': u'2011-12-13', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'5404241738f0d80e250f4915'}

{'headline': 'Coaching Gives Abusers Opportunity and Trust', 'abstract': 'Wave of coaches embroiled in child sexual abuse scandals is garnering a closer look at the link between coaching and molestation; experts say the sports environment has all the ingredients to facilitate misconduct: coaches have close relationships with children and unsupervised access to them, while holding a position of trust and authority that can often keep children from reporting abuses.', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 1461, 'snippet': 'Experts say that the sports environment, where coaches have close relationships with children and easy access to them, can keep children from reporting sexual abuse.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Football', u'Basketball', u'Hockey, Ice', u'Athletics and Sports', u'Sex Crimes', u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'College Athletics', u'Coaches and Managers', u'Basketball (College)', u'Football (College)'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/11/sports/culture-of-sports-works-against-children-especially-boys-reporting-abuse.html', 'date': u'2011-12-11', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'5404194738f0d80e250f4879'}

{'headline': 'Sandusky Arrested on Charges Involving Two New Accusers', 'abstract': 'Jerry Sandusky, former Penn State assistant football coach charged with 40 counts of sexually abusing eight boys, is arrested on new charges involving two additional accusers who testified before a grand jury that they were molested or raped by Sandusky over a period of years.', 'locations': [], 'word_count': 758, 'snippet': 'The arrest of Jerry Sandusky, the former Penn State assistant football coach, followed grand jury testimony by two additional accusers.', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'Child Abuse and Neglect', u'Sex Crimes', u'Football (College)'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2011/12/08/sports/ncaafootball/sandusky-arrested-on-new-sexual-abuse-charges.html', 'date': u'2011-12-08', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'515db24dcf28d0219d003765'}

{'headline': 'Big Push of Pill to Marketplace Stirs Debate on Sexual Desire', 'abstract': "German drug giant Boehringer Ingelheim's claim that its new drug can help restore depressed female sex drive has set off debate over what constitutes normal range of sexual desire among women; critics say company is trying to turn low libido into medical pathology; flibanserin was developed as antidepressant, but failed to lift depression; Boehringer says it learned serendipitously that pill, taken daily for weeks, could restore female libido; Food and Drug Administration staff report recommends against approving drug in United States, saying company has not made its case that benefits of daily pill do not outweigh its side effects, which include dizziness, nausea and fatigue; advisory panel of experts at FDA are still to vote on approving pill, which would be first drug aimed specifically at low sex drive in premenopausal women; photos (M)", 'locations': [u'GERMANY'], 'word_count': 1368, 'snippet': 'Ever since Viagra met blockbuster success in 1998, the drug industry has sought a similar pill for women. {'headline': "Paid Notice: Memorials   ROSENFIELD, ALLAN G. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND THE STAFF OF THE GUTTMACHER INSTITUTE MOURN THE PASSING OF OUR BELOVED FRIEND, COLLEAGUE AND SUPPORTER. ALLAN WAS A GIANT IN THE SEXUAL AND REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH FIELD. HIS ENDURING COMMITMENT TO HELPING WOMEN AROUND THE WORLD OBTAIN THE FAMILY PLANNING SERVICES AND OTHER REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH CARE THEY NEED TO IMPROVE THEIR LIVES WAS AN INSPIRATION TO US ALL. WE ARE GRATEFUL THAT ALLAN WAS A MEMBER OF THE GUTTMACHER BOARD FOR MORE THAN 20 YEARS, AND SERVED AS ITS CHAIR FROM 1993 TO 1995; HE BECAME AN EMERITUS MEMBER IN 2006. HIS INTELLECT AND VISION HELPED MAKE THE GUTTMACHER INSTITUTE A STRONGER, MORE EFFECTIVE ORGANIZATION. WE EXTEND OUR DEEPEST SYMPATHY TO ALLAN'S FAMILY AND SHARE THEIR LOSS OF THIS REMARKABLE MAN. ROSENFIELD, ALLAN G., M.D. THE NEW YORK, PRESBYTERIAN HOSPITAL COMMUNITY DEEPLY MOURNS THE LOSS OF OUR DEAR FRIEND AND COLLEAGUE, DR. ALLAN ROSENFIELD. A BRILLIANT MAN AND A LEADER IN THE FIELD OF PUBLIC HEALTH FOR MORE THAN 40 YEARS, DR. ROSENFIELD MADE LASTING IMPROVEMENTS TO THE HEALTH AND HUMAN RIGHTS OF PEOPLE HERE IN NEW YORK AND AROUND THE WORLD. AS ITS DEAN, HE MADE THE COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY MAILMAN SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH ONE OF THE BEST THERE IS. AN OBSTETRICIAN, GYNECOLOGIST, HE HELPED ESTABLISH WOMEN'S HEALTH AS A SUBSPECIALTY, AND WAS AMONG THE FIRST TO DRAW ATTENTION TO THE WOMEN'S HEALTH CRISIS IN THE DEVELOPING WORLD. HE ESTABLISHED THE PIONEERING AVERTING MATERNAL DEATH AND DISABILITY PROGRAM, SUPPORTING MORE THAN 85 PROJECTS IN 50 COUNTRIES. LOCALLY, HE EXPANDED ACCESS TO HEALTH CLINICS IN THE WASHINGTON HEIGHTS COMMUNITY. PASSIONATE AND PERSONABLE, HE INSPIRED EVERYONE HE KNEW, BRINGING PEOPLE TOGETHER TO ACCOMPLISH EVEN THE MOST DIFFICULT CHALLENGES. A TRUE HUMANITARIAN AND TIRELESS ADVOCATE FOR HEALTH OF THE MOST VULNERABLE POPULATIONS, HE WILL FOREVER SERVE AS A MODEL OF COMPASSION AND COURAGE. OUR HEARTFELT CONDOLENCES TO DR. ROSENFIELD'S WIFE, CLARE, AND THE ENTIRE ROSENFIELD FAMILY. HERBERT PARDES, M.D. PRESIDENT AND CEO NY, PRESBYTERIAN HOSPITAL ROSENFIELD, ALLAN. THE NEW YORK ACADEMY OF MEDICINE ACKNOWLEDGES WITH PROFOUND SORROW THE DEATH OF ALLAN ROSENFIELD, M.D., FELLOW AND TRUSTEE OF THE ACADEMY AND THE 2006 RECIPIENT OF THE STEPHEN SMITH AWARD FOR LIFETIME ACHIEVEMENT IN PUBLIC HEALTH. WE JOIN MANY IN HONORING HIS OUTSTANDING INTERNATIONAL ACCOMPLISH MENTS AND LIFELONG COMMITMENT TO CHAMPIONING THE RIGHTS AND HEALTH OF WOMEN, PROMOTING INTERVENTIONS TO IMPROVE MATERNAL AND CHILD HEALTH, AND FIGHTING FOR HEALTH POLICIES TO PROTECT THE POOR AND DISADVANTAGED. HE WAS A TRANSFORMATIONAL LEADER OF THE COLUMBIA SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH, TIRELESS CONTRIBUTOR TO COUNTLESS ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS, AND DEEPLY VALUED FRIEND AND COLLEAGUE. WE ARE ESPECIALLY GRATEFUL FOR HIS SUPPORT OF THE ACADEMY. THE ACADEMY BOARD, FELLOWS AND STAFF EXTEND DEEPEST CONDOLENCES TO HIS FAMILY. JO IVEY BOUFFORD, M.D. PRESIDENT THOMAS Q. MORRIS, M.D., CHAIRMAN, BOARD OF TRUSTEES ROSENFIELD, DR. ALLAN. TO SAY I KNEW THIS MAN, WHO TOUCHED SO MANY MILLIONS OF LIVES IN SUCH PROFOUND WAYS, IS HUMBLING. THE WORLD IS DIMINISHED BY HIS DEATH, INDEED AS IT HAS BENEFITTED SO MUCH BY HIS EXTRAORDINARY LIFE. MY THOUGHTS ARE WITH CLARE AND HER FAMILY. ROBERT MITCHELL ROSENFIELD, ALLAN. THE BOARD AND STAFF OF PUBLIC HEALTH SOLUTIONS SEND OUR CONDOLENCES TO THE ROSENFIELD FAMILY AND ALLAN'S MANY FRIENDS. WHILE THE WORLD HAS LOST A TRUE HUMANITARIAN, HIS ACCOMPLISHMENTS WILL CONTINUE TO BENEFIT PUBLIC HEALTH. DEBORAH M. SALE, CHAIRPERSON AND ELLEN RAUTENBERG, PRESIDENT AND CEO ROSENFIELD, ALLAN. THE STAFF OF THE NEW YORK", 'locations': [], 'word_count': 930, 'snippet': 'ROSENFIELD--Allan G. {'headline': "JUSTICES, 6-3, LEGALIZE GAY SEXUAL CONDUCT IN SWEEPING REVERSAL OF COURT'S '86 RULING", 'abstract': "Supreme Court overrules Texas sodomy law in broadest possible terms, issuing sweeping declaration of constitutional liberty for gay men and lesbians; vote is 6 to 3; majority says court's contrary 1986 decision 'demeans the lives of homosexual persons'; Justice Anthony M Kennedy, writing for court, says state cannot control gays' destiny by making their private sexual conduct a crime; result was widely anticipated, but few expected decision of such scope from court that only 17 years ago dismissed same constitutional argument as 'facetious'; Justice Antonin Scalia, in scathing dissent, accuses court of taking sides in culture war and signing on to 'so-called homosexual agenda'; case stems from suit brought by two Houston men who were arrested and prosecuted for having sex in their home; decision is expected to have profound legal and political implications; photos; map showing 13 states that have sodomy laws, now invalidated by Supreme Court (L)", 'locations': [u'TEXAS', u'HOUSTON (TEX)'], 'word_count': 1484, 'snippet': 'The Supreme Court issued a sweeping declaration of constitutional liberty for gay men and lesbians today, overruling a Texas sodomy law in the broadest possible terms and effectively apologizing for a contrary 1986 decision that the majority said ...', 'source': u'The New York Times', 'subjects': [u'STATES (US)', u'SUITS AND LITIGATION', u'DISCRIMINATION', u'LAW AND LEGISLATION', u'FREEDOM AND HUMAN RIGHTS', u'DECISIONS AND VERDICTS', u'PRIVACY', u'HOMOSEXUALITY'], 'url': u'https://www.nytimes.com/2003/06/27/us/supreme-court-homosexual-rights-justices-6-3-legalize-gay-sexual-conduct.html', 'date': u'2003-06-27', 'type': u'News', 'id': u'4fd274058eb7c8105d831975'}

{'headline': 'A Magic Mountain of Fresh Air, Sexual Frolicking and, Oh, Yes, Recovery', 'abstract': 'Dr Victoria E Rinehart has gathered stories, letters and interviews in her book Portrait of Healing: Curing in the Woods, about Adirondack tuberculosis sanitarium and its founder Dr Edward Livingston Trudeau; treatment for his patients involved strict regimen regarding food, rest and activities, but book shows a softer side of life there, including secret romance between patients; some historians doubt glowing stories, noting that patients were removed from their families, sometimes for years, and felt obliged to be up-beat as part of treatment; grounds are still used as research facility, although not for tuberculosis; photos (L)', 'locations': [u'ADIRONDACK MOUNTAINS (NYS)'], 'word_count': 1402, 'snippet': 'Nestled amid the grand estates of the Adirondack Mountains 300 miles north of New York City is a red one-room cabin.
